attributes.action: Stop plans to pay for the restoration of properties belonging to the super rich.
attributes.background: In the current economic climate, it is morally wrong to use public funds to pay for the restoration of such buildings as Wentworth Woodhouse and Buckingham Palace. The owners of said properties should be the ones to pay and the money earmarked for this should be passed on to the NHS immediately.

attributes.action: Review the cases of each of the 3859 prisoners still held under IPP scheme
attributes.background: As of September, 3,859 prisoners were still in custody after being sentenced to an IPP and more than 8/10 were beyond the expiry date of the original sentence. IPP was scrapped in 2012. What they have served is disproportionate to the crimes they have committed.

attributes.action: stop funding the royal family with taxpayers money
attributes.background: the royal family is one of the wealthiest in the world. Whilst I don't wish to be disrespectful to HRH we should stop or at least suspend payments from the civil list
attributes.additional_details: many people are going hungry, living out of food banks, having to choose between rent, food or heating. homelessness has risen to an all time high. front line services are strapped for cash. the british tax payer can no longer afford to fund the lavish lifestyle of one of the wealthiest families in the world.

attributes.action: Reduce teachers stress by limiting teaching contact hours to maximum 18hrs/ week
attributes.background: There have been many reports that teachers face too much stress and increasing workloads are reducing, not only the quality of teaching, but the mental health of our educators. Planning and assessing takes time. Teachers currently teach upto 25.5 hours which is too much with other duties needed.
attributes.additional_details: A 2015 study showed that 89% of 3500 teachers stated that workloads are a problem with 2/3 stating they are considering leaving. Teachers are not given a good work-life balance and often work at home because they do not have enough time to complete all tasks in normal working hours- with most reporting they work 60+ hrs /wk.  Teachers are currently expected to teach 25.5 hrs/wk. By legally reducing this to 18 classroom hours we can reduce stress and allow a more reasonable work week for teachers

attributes.action: Reduce government approved hazardous waste being sent to our UK landfill sites
attributes.background: Ministers have made the decision NOT to remove the hazardous Air Pollution Control Residues from our landfills.  They agreed to keep the levels of landfill waste at 3X more hazardous than ever before. That is equal to 100+ Olympic sized swimming pools being filled each year with hazardous waste.
attributes.additional_details: DEFRA were reviewing the use of 3x WAC derogation in light of the implementation of the waste hierarchy and government's hazardous waste strategy in 2010.  Principle 6 states that 'The practice of relying on higher Landfill Directive waste acceptance criteria (derogation for 3x WAC) to enable hazardous waste to continue to be land filled must end'. After 6 years of advising, meetings and false promises, the government have agreed to keep filling our landfills. They have ignored their own advice.

attributes.action: Include sexual orientation and gender identity in sexual education.
attributes.background: Sexual education often only talks about heterosexual sex and relationships, which often leaves LGBT people feel left out as they cannot relate to the things they're being taught. By including information about sexual/gender identity, this would help people to understand them and not bully them.
attributes.additional_details: According to Keelly Abbott, “Lesbian, gay and bisexual students could be left vulnerable here with a lack of any sex education that is relevant to them.”, which is often the case. Without the attention to homosexual relationships and gender identity, homophobia and transphobia is prevalent in schools. 50% of trans people, in a study provided by Huffington post, said that they'd experienced transphobic bullying, and 69.1% of LGBT members experiencing homophobia and biphobia.

attributes.action: Postpone notice under art.50 until the question on revocation has been answered.
attributes.background:
The question as to whether notice under art.50 can be revoked once issued remains open, however a definitive answer to this question would be useful to allow MPs to make constructive decisions on the exit process.

A case currently before the High Court in Ireland is addressing this very question.
attributes.additional_details:
This would not be going against the result of the referendum, but would simply allow for Parliament to have the information it needs to properly consider its position and its options and whether a future vote on a proposed deal will be truly meaningful.

Those advocating leaving the EU have waited years for this moment. Waiting a little longer for Parliament to have the information required to consider its options is in the interests of our democracy.

attributes.action: Pay sick pay to employees who have been in service for more than 2 years
attributes.background: I am a reliable employee who only takes time off when I am genuinely too ill to get to work but will still go in when I'm too unwell to because I do not get sick pay. Yes I'm entitled to SSP but I would have to be off work for more than for days and it doesn't cover my wages.
attributes.additional_details:
I have been at this work post for 4 years and am a reliable, honest and hard working person. I feel it unfair that I and others in my situation do not have our salary protected for a certain number of weeks a year and are forced to either go in to work sick, have our salary compromised or take more time that is required off just to claim SSP, which I have only ever done once. 
I would like to see employers be made to offer sick pay/salary protection to employees in service for over 2 years

attributes.action: Include the dangers of online grooming in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I would like children to be taught about the dangers of online grooming alongside their learning about IT and computers. Paedophiles use the internet to groom young people, but currently this isn't taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Children should be made aware of the dangers around online grooming, and it should be made a part of the national curriculum.

attributes.action: The UK government should not enter into any trade negotiations with the USA.
attributes.background: The US administration has put forward the climate change denying America First Energy Policy.  Until such time as this policy is reversed and they take clear and measurable steps to reduce C02 emissions the UK must not enter into any trade negotiations with the USA.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.whitehouse.gov/america-first-energy

attributes.action: Allow enlisted men to bear arms around the clock for personal protection in UK
attributes.background:
Our serving military should be allowed to carry sidearms at all times for self defense and for national security so they may act without hesitation to any terrorist threat to themselves or our nation
Our military are trained and are under oath to serve and protect our nation!
Please sign and share
attributes.additional_details:
No more attacks on our protectors like the horrific killing of Fusilier Lee Rigby RIP
Stop the attempted abductions of our serving men and women.
Give our heros the chance to protect themselves along with protecting our nation.

attributes.action: Make PIP Questionnaires fit for purpose regarding Mental Health.
attributes.background:
I believe that the PIP Medical Questionnaire isn't fit for purpose. 
Most questions on the form are aimed at people with physical problems. There are no questions to help you explain about Mental Health & how it effects you daily, which it does.
attributes.additional_details:
So I am starting this petition to see if we can all come together & get the form changed to suit all medical problems like Mental Health. So we can get the right support, which we deserve...

Please sign & share - thank you - Karen Billingsley.

attributes.action: Facilitate 100% mortgages for those renting privately.
attributes.background: There is gap in the 'help to buy' scheme that doesn't facilitate those people who are stuck in the private rental market.  People that regularly evidence the ability to make mortgage payment, but do not have the ability to put away enough savings to reach a 5-10% deposit.
attributes.additional_details: There is a next generation issue, of those people that have young families but are now stuck in the rental market.  Quite often the rental costs are higher than what a mortgage would cost, but due to the often higher rental changes to facilitate a family home these people can not accrue enough savings quickly enough to purchase a property.

attributes.action: Make cyclists speeding illegal and insurance mandatory for cyclists
attributes.background: Following serious injuries sustained on my mum by a cyclist doing twice the legal car speed limit in Greenwich park I would like cycle speed limits reviewed, cycle paths reviewed and tracking imposed and the cyclist public liability insurance made mandatory
attributes.additional_details: When treating my mums multiple injuries and assisting her recovery the emergency services advised that a cycle path was removed downhill in Greenwich park which could have prevented this and when trying to slow cyclists down the police get significant abuse from cyclists I therefore think there is a need for a full review of laws relating to cyclists, their speed and actions to prevent such accidents occurring to pedestrians

attributes.action: Unemployment benefits to stop after 2 years of claiming
attributes.background: Unemployment benefits should stop after claims of 2 years or more. The goverment said it would make work pay and put an end to career claiments. We want the goverment to make long time unemployed get back to work and make Britain great again.

attributes.action: Make Health Tourists pay for their treatment
attributes.background: We believe that people who are not from the UK and use the NHS for treatment should be made to pay. Health Tourism costs the NHS between £200m and £2bn. It is time the Government acted and stopped the chronic abuse of health tourists using the NHS for free and made them pay their way.

attributes.action: Mandate ethnic diversity in jury selection where minorities are defendants.
attributes.background: The view that currently underpins jury policy in England & Wales is that a randomly selected jury is most likely to be representative and therefore most likely to be impartial. However several studies have shown that it is in the nature of random selection that some juries will be unrepresentative.
attributes.additional_details:
This particularly applies to cases involving defendants from ethnic minorities. Random selection from a populous where 87.2% of people are white, naturally results in a high likelihood of white-only juries. This raises conflicts in cultural norms and community values. Parliament needs to ensure that this imbalance is removed and one is judged by 'a jury of their peers' to preserve equality, fairness and overall confidence in our legal system.

https://goo.gl/vZxgqS
https://goo.gl/EbKEld

attributes.action: Postpone the revised GCSE in Maths and English set to be taken this summer.
attributes.background: Current Year 11 pupils who are due to sit the revised GCSE exams this summer in Maths and English have attained well below their expected previous grades in recent mock examinations.  This is due to the escalated rate in which the revised curriculum has been introduced.
attributes.additional_details: I am a primary school teacher and the director of private day nurseries but more importantly a parent of a Year 11 pupil.

attributes.action: Teach taxes, financial situations, bills, and how to handle money, in schools
attributes.background: This petition is for taxes, bills, loans, mortgages and money/bank situations to be taught in secondary schools, as I have left school myself and starting to deal with financial situations etc. I am oblivious to financial dealings and friends of my age also have no knowledge on money transactions.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be allowed with a specific liecence per event
attributes.background:
Fireworks can cause injury to bystanders.  
Fireworks cause distress people's pets. 
Fireworks should only be ignited by a pyrotechnics person.
Fireworks should not be allowed on private property they should only be allowed in a designated public area with a specific license per event.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the risks fireworks bring it is requested that they are only ignited by a professional pyrotechnics person.  They should only be allowed in designated public places. They should require a licence from the local council. This will safe guard children and animals and ensure this safety risk and noise pollution is managed in a fair socially considered manner

attributes.action: Stop HS2 tunnel plan in Longsight Manchester
attributes.background: As a Longsight resident, I have not received information about how the tunnel affects me or what my rights are. Speaking to other residents they feel the same. The impact of this on people's lives and future plans if they end of selling has to be reviewed and the plans on the HS2 tunnel halted.

attributes.action: Ensure  the UK can trade tariff free in the EU single market after Brexit
attributes.background: It is vital for jobs and UK prosperity that the UK does not cut off the inportant markets of the EU to UK business after Brexit. Our Financial services are the backbone of our economy and must have full passporting rights going forward. The industrial sector too must not be penalised for Brexit

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for young adults under the age of 18
attributes.background: The minimum wage being £3.87 for 16 and 17 year olds can not only put young people off working, but also reduces their financial independence. It should be raised to at least £4.50 so these under 18 year olds can get a worthwhile and rewarding payment for their labour time.

attributes.action: Create policy, guidance for children's services, legal services and parents.
attributes.background: It is felt that there is a lack of awareness and support for children who are caught up in contact and custody disputes. There is a lack of guidance and support to help children have a healthy ongoing relationship with both parents and in doing so maintain their psychological health.
attributes.additional_details: I am raising awareness of the vulnerability of children caught in high conflict contact and custody disputes and their need to access specialist assessment and, where appropriate, intervention, to ensure their improved opportunities for ongoing relationships with both parents, and their long term psychological health. In doing this there is a need for policy/legislation/guidance for children's services, legal services and parents to raise a concern and have access to the support to resolve it.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cars to pass horses at no more than 15mph
attributes.background: There is an increase in the number of tragic accidents caused by vehicles passing horses far too quickly and not allowing sufficient room to pass.   This can be reduced by making it a legal requirement for vehicles to pass slow and wide.

attributes.action: To give assistant/therapy dogs the same recognition as Guide and Hearing dogs.
attributes.background: Guide/Hearing Dogs are recognised by shops to give them admission. However, therapy and assistance don't have the rights to enter establishments with those they support, this disadvantages the person the dog is with. I am looking to give these useful dogs the same recognition in law.

attributes.action: Implement the recommendations of the Cttee on Economic, Social & Cultural Rights
attributes.background: The UN Committee on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights issued a damning report on the UK’s compliance with international human rights law, and made 60 specific recommendations. The government must explain to Parliament and the British public how it intends to implement them.
attributes.additional_details:
The government missed the opportunity of the 2016 Autumn statement to start decisively allocating the necessary resources to fulfil the economic and social rights recognised in international human rights law. 

Find out more background information here: http://www.just-fair.co.uk/2016-concluding-observations

The UK’s human rights record will be reviewed again in the UN Universal Periodic Review in May 2017.

attributes.action: Remove all American military bases from UK soil.
attributes.background: A relic of the second world war, the UK is littered with underused American military bases, thousands of acres of beautiful UK countryside is being left to waste with no advantage to the UK at all, it's just waste land, not even wildlife is welcome.
attributes.additional_details:
The United States has thousands of acres of UK soil for their own military use which is of very little advantage to us, they provide minimal economic benefits or defence as they are self sufficient and more likely to attract enemies to our shores.
 These bases are generally in prime locations and could be used in countless ways to boost our economy, housing, farming or simply given back to nature to enhance our countryside. American military bases are of no use to the UK, take our country back.

attributes.action: For the UK to remain a full member of the single market
attributes.background: The petition calls on Parliament not to permit the Prime Minster to invoke Article 50 unless the government promises to negotiate for full membership of the single market

attributes.action: Ban homework in the UK
attributes.background: The children do plenty of work in school
attributes.additional_details: How are they supposed to eat, hang out with friends, do school clubs, bathe and get 8 hours of sleep when they have so much homework?

attributes.action: Make anti homeless spikes and other measures of equal effect illegal
attributes.background: "Anti homeless spikes" have been used in public places, especially outside businesses, to prevent those without a home from sleeping there. It is an inhumane means of dealing with the issue and to subject them to further inconvenience, deprives those living in extreme poverty of any dignity.
attributes.additional_details: We have to transition from criminalising poverty, to criminalising behaviour that punishes poverty. The government's lack of action in tackling the problem has led to establishments assuming responsibility and taking measures such as these spikes. Parliament however must act in not furthering the suffering of those living through difficult circumstances. In certain instances individuals have frozen to death and these spikes have forced the displaced to sleep in lethal conditions.

attributes.action: Scrap the idea to hand over maintenance responsibility from Network Rail to TOCs
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government announced[1] a decision to instead of having a state run company maintaining Britain's rail network to instead hand over the responsibility to private TOC's. Her Majesty's Government has previously privatized the maintenance with disastrous results[2][3][4]
attributes.additional_details:
[1] http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/02/exclusive-network-rail-stripped-control-britains-train-tracks/

[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bexley_railway_station#History

[3] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatfield_rail_crash#Cause

[4]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potters_Bar_rail_accidents#2002

attributes.action: Request that the government revoke Govia's contract for Southern Rail
attributes.background:
Southern Rail customers are fed up with the continued poor service -cancelled trains, late trains, trains will less cars than normal, poor compensation.
This is also starting to affect employees and employers when people are continually late or need to leave early

attributes.action: Government should stage a new cultural Festival of Britain
attributes.background: The Opening Ceremonies of the 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games did much to tell the world what makes Britain Great.  Let's have a cultural Festival of Britain in this post Brexit climate to demonstrate what an amazing nation this is and that we continue to welcome the world
attributes.additional_details: Let's celebrate what makes this nation great in the ways that we did over 2012. Let's reach out and show the world what a vibrant and amazing country we live in, what we have to give to the world through culture and the wider creative sectors which lie at the heart of our thriving knowledge economy

attributes.action: Make Byways Safer
attributes.background: Byways are being used increasingly by motor bikers, as off road circuits, which is putting other users such as walkers and horse riders at risk. Riders in particular, are vulnerable, and a serious accident seems inevitable. We need biker restrictions urgently enforced, before someone is killed.

attributes.action: Fund the NHS more money so that ambulance response times improve
attributes.background: Ambulances take a long time to get to people. My Grandfather broke his leg and the ambulance didn't get to him till an hour after being called. If the ambulance had responded sooner then his pain would've been relieved quicker. Give more money to the NHS and stuff like this would be prevented

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC Television Licence.
attributes.background: The BBC licence fee is a unlawful tax against watching television. The BBC should not dictate our ability to watch television such as ITV and Channel 4.

attributes.action: Stop the total smoking ban in psychiatric hospitals.
attributes.background: Legislation comes into force in NHS psychiatric hospitals on 1st October 2016.  Smoking is already limited to certain areas and at certain times so those who do not smoke are not adversely affected.  The last thing distressed people need is to have their de-stressing mechanism denied them.
attributes.additional_details: I have a relative who is on her 3rd "episode", hence another lengthy stay on a mental health ward.  New arrivals to a ward are already under stress.  I am not a smoker myself but I see many patients desperate for the next smoking break to help them relax.  Who will have to deal with this extra agitation?  Staff who are already under pressure.  The legislation may be well intentioned but I think it is totally wrong to impose a smoking ban on patients who are locked up and whose "home" is the ward

attributes.action: Work with governments in other countries to take action against child soldiers
attributes.background:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against.
#ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou
attributes.additional_details:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against. 
 We decided child soldiers as children younger than us are being kidnapped and forced to become soldiers. This is something we feel strongly and passionate about as it is something that affects children and their lives. #ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for building companies to have indemnity insurance
attributes.background: This is to protect consumers against rogue traders, not finishing work, doing incorrect and unsafe work then closing that business down and the consumer unable to claim  any monies back from the builder. This way consumers could then claim against their insurance.

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Teach about lesbian-specific protection in schools.
attributes.background: While every school teaches students to use a condom to protect from pregnancy and STI's, very few even mention lesbian-specific protection.  Young women should be formally educated on the risks they face when engaging in same-sex sexual activities and how best to avoid them.
attributes.additional_details:
I was shocked to learn at the age of eighteen (two years after the age whereby one can consent to having sex) that lesbian-specific protection exists. 

From asking people on my social media, only 18/100 people were taught about this protection in school, while 32/100 knew it existed.  

There is a call for homosexual sex-ed lessons in schools, but lesbian protection should be taught as a priority as a matter of promoting safe sex.  Everyone should know how to protect themselves and stay safe.

attributes.action: Establish an independent inquiry into Child Sexual Exploitation in Telford
attributes.background: Telford & Wrekin has more reports of Child Sexual Exploitation per capita than anywhere else in the UK. There are 15 reports per 10,000 people in Telford & Wrekin compared to 6.4 in Rotherham. An independent inquiry would establish (as it did in Rotherham) the facts behind this disturbing statistic.
attributes.additional_details: Telford has been described as the "child sex capital of Britain". There could be as many as 2,300 victims in Telford & Wrekin - 40% more than Rotherham's 1,400 - based on being 2 and a half times more likely to be a victim in Telford & Wrekin which has 60% of the population of Rotherham.

attributes.action: Do not stop PSA Prostate Specific Antigen tests for men.
attributes.background: I have have suffered prostate cancer and had a prostatectomy. The issue was highlighted following a blood test for PSA. I had no symptoms, don't smoke or drink and keep fit
attributes.additional_details:
It was the my manager who encouraged me to go for a test following a friend suffering the disease. Had I not had the test I would now be in the advanced stages of cancer and do not know how long I would have to live. 
Further to this I know of three other men with the same story.
If this is stopped men will die.PSA test will show your individual PSA level and enable you monitor of your reading. Its a simple blood test and nothing more.

attributes.action: Make PIP more accessible to people with rare illnesses
attributes.background: I have suffered from Guillain Barre Syndrome for five years. I have pins and needles in my feet which make it very painful to walk, and muscle weakness and pains in my arms. I am currently waiting a decision from the Upper Tribunal. There are many other people out there in the same position.
attributes.additional_details: There are approximately 1 in every 200,000 get GBS and 20% of these have some form of residual issues. I returned to work because I wanted to try and get back to normal. This hasn't happened and I had to became part-time. I only work two days at a time because I get too tired. I have to get taxi's when I go anywhere because I am unable to use public transport unless someone is with me. Nerve damage means I will not recover. Disabled people need your help.

attributes.action: Make work experience a compulsory part of the Yr 9 and Yr 11 curriculum again.
attributes.background: We are being made to make choices that may shape our entire career without having been given the opportunity to experience a working environment.  If work experience was compulsory we could experience different types of jobs and make informed choices about what qualifications we wanted to pursue.
attributes.additional_details: If 2 opportunities were given in Yr 9 and Yr 11 to undertake 2 weeks of work experience young people would be able to make better informed GCSE and A Level choices.  It would also allow them the opportunity to build their character by recognising what key skills they may need to develop further.  It also allows them potential segues into jobs when they reach school leaving age.  This opportunity for personal development should be just as essential as the rest of the curriculum.

attributes.action: Make menstrual cups available on the NHS
attributes.background: According to a Huffington Post article women spend £6000 on sanitary products in a lifetime.Providing menstrual cups on the NHS would save women thousands. As they are reuseable it not only provides a good solution for the costly issues but also the environmental issues that sanitary products create
attributes.additional_details: Women on average use around 11,000 disposable sanitary products in a lifetime, which end up in a landfill or the sea. The time it takes for a tampon or pad to degrade in landfills is centuries, particularly when wrapped in a plastic bag. Ocean Conservancy volunteers collected 27,938 used tampons and applicators on our world’s beaches on a single day (International Coastal Cleanup, 2013). Since a menstrual cup can last for up to 10 years, using one would prevent a decade's worth of waste.

attributes.action: Abolish the pay to stay proposals in the current housing bill.
attributes.background: The pay to stay policy is part of the current Housing Bill that is going through parliament. This policy will mean social housing tenants who's household income exceeds £30,000 (£40,000 in London) will be required to pay market rents for their home. This will have a devastating affect on families.
attributes.additional_details: There are several articles circulating with people's stories and how it will affect them. I believe the threshold is far too low, as a family earning £3/40,000 a year would not be able to buy a home on this income. Moreover, there are no controls on the current market so prices are ridiculously high. Families will split to avoid exceeding the threshold or the stress/strain of paying 150% more in rent. This policy will make people homeless or push 1000s into extreme poverty.

attributes.action: Change the law to require all bus companies to offer free travel for children
attributes.background: In London 11 to 15 year olds currently get free travel. This should be available to all children nationally and the law should be changed to require bus companies to offer free travel to children nationally. This would reduce congestion & pollution as parents would encourage children to use buses.

attributes.action: Help from the NHS to provide more mental health support for people aged 16-18.
attributes.background: The NHS have many adolescent services but long waiting lists mean that support is unavailable when people most critically need it. When people reach 17, they no longer fit the criteria for an adolescent patient, but don't fit in the age range for adult services, so they are left without support.
attributes.additional_details: Being left to find private services at the age of 17 can be very difficult for families as a result of the very high prices. The cost of services can prevent these people from getting the support they need. This time without care can be very detrimental to a young person with poor mental health, so therefore the gap between adolescent and adult services needs to be filled.
